meta.title: A COVID Diary: A Pharmacist's Pandemic Chronicle
meta.author: Steve Smoke
meta.description: Structured chapter data extracted from the Covid-19 Timeline document for use in a React-based interactive website.

chapters.title: The Before Times
chapters.subtitle: From First Reports to First Cases
chapters.vibe_description: A calm before the storm. Casual dismissal of early warning signs, life proceeding normally — Rutgers basketball, work trips, grocery runs.

clinical_nodes.label: First Cases
clinical_nodes.content: First reported cases of Covid-19 in Wuhan, China.

clinical_nodes.label: WHO Bulletin
clinical_nodes.content: Novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) outbreak noted on Twitter / WHO. Author dismisses it, citing precedent of Zika, Ebola, SARS, MERS not spreading substantially.

clinical_nodes.label: First US Case
clinical_nodes.content: First confirmed US case reported in Washington State.

clinical_nodes.label: SBMC AMS Prep Meeting
clinical_nodes.content: Dr. Miller mentions coronavirus might be a big deal. Author dismisses the idea as unlikely and unrelated to AMS agenda.

clinical_nodes.label: RWJBH ID / Infection Control Meeting
clinical_nodes.content: Novel coronavirus (nCoV-2019) officially renamed Covid-19. Topics: employee travel screening, mask shortage, testing protocols.

clinical_nodes.label: Puerto Rico Work Trip
clinical_nodes.content: Extended discussion with Ernani (Population Health MD) during flight delay about openness to travel amid impending Covid-19 wave. He poses a hypothetical: would author travel in May?

clinical_nodes.label: First NJ Case
clinical_nodes.content: First confirmed New Jersey case reported in Fort Lee.

personal_nodes.label: Dismissal
personal_nodes.content: Author sees coronavirus news on Twitter and doesn't think much of it — mentally files it with prior outbreaks that 'never really spread.'

personal_nodes.label: Rutgers Basketball
personal_nodes.content: Rutgers beats #21 Illinois. Program on track for first NCAA tournament berth in 30 years.

personal_nodes.label: Amy Prepares
personal_nodes.content: While Steve is in Puerto Rico, Amy begins preparing for potential Covid-19 wave — first grocery haul and cleaning supplies.

chapters.title: The Run Up
chapters.subtitle: March 9–13, 2020: The Week Everything Changed
chapters.vibe_description: Five days of cascading cancellations, first treatment emails, and the dawning realization that this is real. The world of sports collapses in real time.

clinical_nodes.label: First Remdesivir Email
clinical_nodes.content: Indu (Chief Pharmacy Officer) sends first corporate email discussing remdesivir. Position: do not advocate without clinical trial data, but IND compassionate use is reasonable for highest-risk, critically ill patients.

clinical_nodes.label: RWJBH ID / IC Meeting — Dr. Boruchoff's Warning
clinical_nodes.content: Dr. Boruchoff argues the system is moving too slowly: 'We need to prepare for what transmission will be, not what it currently is. We will be overrun.' Next 3 meetings are canceled.

clinical_nodes.label: First ID Pharmacy Collaborative Email
clinical_nodes.content: Author sends inaugural email to ID Pharmacy Collaborative sharing a treatment Google doc. Key assessments: Tamiflu unlikely to work; Remdesivir under NIH study; Chloroquine shows 'promising but questionable' evidence from China; Lopinavir/ritonavir retrospective shows no efficacy. Anticipates 'constantly changing evidence.'

clinical_nodes.label: Call for Standard Algorithm
clinical_nodes.content: Author emails Christian (RWJBH AMS Chair), Indu (CPO), and Jen (Corporate Clinical Pharmacy): 'We need a standard treatment algorithm.'

clinical_nodes.label: First Draft Treatment Protocol
clinical_nodes.content: Nav (NB ID PharmD) sends draft treatment protocol — revised 3-4 times in one day. Two pathways: one for ID-managed patients, one for surge overflow. Criteria: ICU / supplemental O2 / high-risk. Preferred: remdesivir compassionate use, then hydroxychloroquine. If ICU: sarilumab via trial or tocilizumab.

clinical_nodes.label: Dr. Hasan Remdesivir Inquiry
clinical_nodes.content: Dr. Hasan (CBMC Peds ID) asks about process to obtain remdesivir for pediatric use.

personal_nodes.label: Distracted by Covid
personal_nodes.content: Author is supposed to be prepping for NJSID meeting presentation but can't focus — convinced this will be a major problem after seeing community transmission data from Washington State.

personal_nodes.label: NBA / Utah Jazz Positive Test
personal_nodes.content: Utah Jazz player tests positive; NBA season suspended.

personal_nodes.label: Big Ten Tournament Canceled
personal_nodes.content: B10 tournament canceled while Rutgers is on the court warming up. NHL season also suspended. The Rutgers tournament dream dies.

personal_nodes.label: NCAA March Madness Canceled
personal_nodes.content: NCAA March Madness officially canceled.

personal_nodes.label: NJSID Meeting Canceled
personal_nodes.content: New Jersey Society of Infectious Diseases cancels its meeting.

image12 — Photo associated with March 12 Big Ten / NHL cancellations

chapters.title: Exponential Growth
chapters.subtitle: The Hydroxychloroquine Wars
chapters.vibe_description: A frantic three weeks of evolving guidelines, drug shortages, political interference, Twitter misinformation, and inter-physician conflict over HCQ dosing. The science is moving faster than anyone can track.

clinical_nodes.label: Ibuprofen Controversy
clinical_nodes.content: French Health Minister tweets that ibuprofen could be an aggravating factor. Anecdotal and pharmacological speculation, not evidence-based. WHO temporarily recommends against ibuprofen; WHO and EMA later retract on 3/19.

clinical_nodes.label: HCQ Stockpile Revealed
clinical_nodes.content: Indu (CPO) shares that RWJBH has stockpiled hydroxychloroquine and requests an algorithm for distribution.

clinical_nodes.label: HCQ Protocol Version 3
clinical_nodes.content: Nav (NB ID PharmD) sends updated recommendations: HCQ for most eligible patients, remdesivir via clinical trial if mechanically ventilated, IL-6 antagonist if ARDS. RWJBH AMS distributes first formal guidance (Version 3).

clinical_nodes.label: Steroids Debate Begins
clinical_nodes.content: Steve shares JAMA retrospective suggesting steroids may help; CDC and WHO recommend against them at this time. Later proven to reduce mortality.

clinical_nodes.label: First Staff Pharmacist Presentation
clinical_nodes.content: Author gives first Covid-19 presentation to CBMC staff pharmacists. Packed room. Most questions cannot be answered.

clinical_nodes.label: NEJM: Lopinavir/r Not Effective
clinical_nodes.content: NEJM RCT published: lopinavir/ritonavir not effective for Covid-19. Removed from future protocol versions.

clinical_nodes.label: French HCQ Study Circulates
clinical_nodes.content: Dr. Smith shares the French HCQ/azithromycin study. Not yet published or peer-reviewed. Debate begins on dosing, azithromycin addition, and QTc monitoring. Trump calls HCQ 'a game changer' at press conference. Azithromycin goes on ASHP shortage.

clinical_nodes.label: HCQ Use 'Out of Control'
clinical_nodes.content: Author notes in email: 'well our use is starting to get out of control.' First daily HCQ tracking reports begin.

clinical_nodes.label: First Compassionate Use Approved
clinical_nodes.content: Author's first Gilead compassionate use remdesivir request (on behalf of Dr. Mistry, ICU) is approved.

clinical_nodes.label: HCQ Duration Curtailed
clinical_nodes.content: Greater than 5-day HCQ duration discouraged due to limited evidence and supply constraints.

clinical_nodes.label: Azithromycin Recommendation Challenged
clinical_nodes.content: Nav and Steve draft SBAR to pull azithromycin from protocol citing: no prior evidence, non-equivalent control group, no clinical benefit demonstrated, and potential QTc toxicity.

clinical_nodes.label: HCQ Dosing Conflict — Dr. Smith
clinical_nodes.content: Dr. Smith (CBMC ID) emails CEO, CMO, Chair of Medicine demanding higher HCQ dosing based on a retrospective, non-comparative French follow-up study. Author provides pushback via email. Smith calls author immediately claiming he was 'stabbed in the back.'

clinical_nodes.label: FDA Emergency Use Authorization
clinical_nodes.content: FDA issues EUA for chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine.

clinical_nodes.label: Tocilizumab Outcomes Concerning
clinical_nodes.content: Suspicion that tocilizumab is being used too late — very few positive outcomes observed.

clinical_nodes.label: Guidelines Updated Again
clinical_nodes.content: Updated guidelines: HCQ duration extended to 5-7 days, tocilizumab criteria broadened, anticoagulation and steroids formally addressed.

personal_nodes.label: Ed's 50th Birthday Skipped
personal_nodes.content: After Chris and Tara's decision, author emails Lisa that he and Amy won't attend Ed's 50th birthday due to Covid-19. Lisa's parents later end up in the ICU; her father passes away.

personal_nodes.label: Amy Works From Home
personal_nodes.content: Amy begins working from home.

personal_nodes.label: Reading Chinese Papers
personal_nodes.content: 'Trying to read all of these Chinese papers' — author uses Google Translate on foreign-language studies to keep up with global evidence.

personal_nodes.label: NJ Closes Nonessential Businesses
personal_nodes.content: New Jersey closes nonessential businesses.

personal_nodes.label: Emails From Strangers
personal_nodes.content: Author receives an email from a new JCMC attending about the guidelines. Over the following weeks, receives emails from a physician in NYC and one in India — both unaffiliated with RWJBH — because the guidelines included his contact info.

personal_nodes.label: Trump Oval Office Meeting
personal_nodes.content: Dr. Smith meets with President Trump, Laura Ingraham, and FDA Director Stephen Hahn to pressure HCQ authorization.

personal_nodes.label: Video Call With Amy
personal_nodes.content: Amy grocery shopping online; communicating via Zoom. Kayleigh and Logan 'living their best life making mud soup.' Amy's knuckles cracked from hand sanitizing. Steve not yet wearing a mask at work — CDC hadn't recommended it for healthcare workers yet. 'We're just a covid hospital, every unit is an ICU, no one knows how to treat it, people want to try everything.' 'My music selection is a good indicator of my mental state — I've been listening to emo like it's 2005.'

chapters.title: The Dark Ages
chapters.subtitle: The Surge, the Silence, and the Trailers
chapters.vibe_description: The hospital empties of non-essential staff but fills with the dying. Empty hallways. Refrigerated trailers in the parking lot. Clap-outs. 'Here Comes the Sun.' Tooth-grinding stress. An overwhelming sense of hopelessness on the morning commute.

clinical_nodes.label: HCQ Skepticism Grows
clinical_nodes.content: NEJM quasi-experimental HCQ study circulates. First serious discussion in the ID pharmacy group of pulling the HCQ recommendation entirely. Group notes that stopping azithromycin 'wasn't as bad as expected.'

clinical_nodes.label: Ivermectin: First and Last (for 8 months)
clinical_nodes.content: Dr. Bessler and Dr. Lin separately ask about ivermectin. Author explains that concentrations required for efficacy are orders of magnitude above what can be safely achieved. No more ivermectin questions for eight months.

clinical_nodes.label: Tocilizumab: Earlier May Be Better
clinical_nodes.content: Preliminary tocilizumab results from Stat Pat suggest earlier administration may be more effective — consistent with clinical suspicion.

clinical_nodes.label: NIH Guidelines Adopted
clinical_nodes.content: RWJBH AMS decides guidelines will mirror NIH guidelines going forward — requiring a much higher evidence threshold before making recommendations. No recommended therapies at this point.

clinical_nodes.label: HCQ Pulled From RWJBH Guidelines
clinical_nodes.content: HCQ recommendation officially removed from RWJBH guidelines based on NIH and IDSA guidance.

clinical_nodes.label: Remdesivir: Contradictory Data
clinical_nodes.content: Chinese remdesivir RCT in Lancet shows no benefit. Same day, NIAID shares (unpublished, non-peer-reviewed) data from its RCT indicating benefit. 'Timing causes considerable confusion.'

clinical_nodes.label: Remdesivir EUA
clinical_nodes.content: FDA issues emergency use authorization for remdesivir.

clinical_nodes.label: Anakinra Early Data
clinical_nodes.content: First retrospective cohort data on anakinra published in The Lancet. Author notes it 'looks better than toci data.' Tocilizumab use dropping significantly.

clinical_nodes.label: HCQ NEJM Study: No Benefit
clinical_nodes.content: Large observational study from NYP published in NEJM finds no benefit from hydroxychloroquine.

clinical_nodes.label: First Remdesivir Shipment
clinical_nodes.content: 26 courses of remdesivir arrive at CBMC around 6-7pm. Dr. Smith pre-emptively enters ~10 orders that evening; most are on patients admitted long ago, unlikely to benefit.

clinical_nodes.label: HCQ Gated to Clinical Trial
clinical_nodes.content: P&T memo to Medical Staff: HCQ for Covid-19 must go through CINJ clinical trial. Non-trial use permitted only if patient is ineligible. Dr. Smith responds calling it 'Tuskegee type illegal.'

personal_nodes.label: The Hospital Empties
personal_nodes.content: Non-essential personnel work from home. Empty hallways and cafeteria. Hospital receives donations: food, drinks, hand sanitizers from distilleries, handwritten letters from children, mask comfort adapters.

personal_nodes.label: Trailers in the Parking Lot
personal_nodes.content: Hospital morgue fills. Two refrigerated trailers placed in the physician parking lot for overflow bodies. They remained for months. Every employee saw them going in and out each day.

personal_nodes.label: 'Here Comes the Sun'
personal_nodes.content: Beatles song played over hospital loudspeaker each time a patient is extubated. Sound quality described as horrendous.

personal_nodes.label: Clap-Outs
personal_nodes.content: Staff line the halls and applaud patients discharged after weeks- or months-long admissions.

personal_nodes.label: Tooth-Grinding
personal_nodes.content: Author notices mild, persistent tooth pain — eventually realizes it is from clenching his jaw. A subconscious physical response to facing unanswerable questions with lives on the line.

personal_nodes.label: Morning Commute Grief
personal_nodes.content: 'I remember getting emotional a few times. It was always on my morning commute... I remember feeling an overwhelming hopelessness. Not just for myself and all the patients and their families. But for everyone I care about and how isolated and scared they must be.'

personal_nodes.label: Hotel Stay
personal_nodes.content: Steve moves into a hotel from April 7 to April 18 to protect his family.

personal_nodes.label: Amy's Knit Mask
personal_nodes.content: Amy handknits a mask for Steve to use outside the hospital, since there were not enough for non-healthcare workers. 'It probably didn't work that well but it meant a lot to me that she worked on it for me.'

personal_nodes.label: Amy Cuts Steve's Hair
personal_nodes.content: Amy cuts Steve's hair. It takes three attempts and two hours, but turns out well. Steve has jealous coworkers.

personal_nodes.label: CDI Plummets, Fungal Infections Rise
personal_nodes.content: Hospital CDI (C. diff) rates plummet due to dramatically improved hand hygiene. Fungal infections, MRSA, and other hospital-acquired infections rise due to the surge in critically ill patients with prolonged stays.

chapters.title: The MAB Graveyard
chapters.subtitle: The Monoclonal Antibody Arms Race
chapters.vibe_description: A two-year arc of approved monoclonal antibodies — each arriving with promise, each eventually rendered obsolete by viral mutation. A clinical arms race the virus ultimately wins.

clinical_nodes.label: Sarilumab Fails Primary Endpoint
clinical_nodes.content: Regeneron reports sarilumab study fails to meet primary endpoint. Criteria was too broad, including circumstances where the drug is ineffective. Later proven effective in more targeted use. Regeneron pivots to monoclonal antibody targeting the spike protein.

clinical_nodes.label: First Compassionate Use: Casirivimab/Imdevimab
clinical_nodes.content: Author works with Dr. Hasan on first (of at least two) compassionate use requests for Regeneron's casirivimab/imdevimab in a pediatric patient.

clinical_nodes.label: Trump Receives Casirivimab/Imdevimab
clinical_nodes.content: President Trump publicly discloses he has Covid-19 and receives casirivimab/imdevimab via compassionate use. Brings considerable media attention to the medication.

clinical_nodes.label: Bamlanivimab EUA Granted
clinical_nodes.content: FDA grants EUA for bamlanivimab. Immediate discussions about where to administer it — Kristine and author suggest the ED. System decides on EDs by November 16.

clinical_nodes.label: Bamlanivimab Dispensing Begins
clinical_nodes.content: CBMC begins dispensing bamlanivimab.

clinical_nodes.label: Casirivimab/Imdevimab EUA
clinical_nodes.content: FDA grants EUA for casirivimab/imdevimab (Regeneron). Both 'bam' and 'Regeneron' used simultaneously based on inconsistent supply.

clinical_nodes.label: Bamlanivimab/Etesevimab EUA
clinical_nodes.content: FDA grants EUA for the combination. Rationale: resistance to bamlanivimab suspected in circulating variants; etesevimab intended to restore activity. Variant monitoring becomes essential to treatment decisions.

clinical_nodes.label: Mutation Reckoning
clinical_nodes.content: Author reflects on prior dismissal of mutation concerns: 'This was very wrong.' First concern was the Alpha variant (UK), more transmissible but not affecting MAB activity. Then variants emerged worldwide.

clinical_nodes.label: Bamlanivimab Alone EUA Revoked
clinical_nodes.content: EUA for single-agent bamlanivimab revoked due to variant resistance.

clinical_nodes.label: Sotrovimab EUA
clinical_nodes.content: FDA grants EUA for sotrovimab.

clinical_nodes.label: Casirivimab/Imdevimab and Bamlanivimab/Etesevimab EUAs Revoked
clinical_nodes.content: Both EUAs revoked due to variant resistance.

clinical_nodes.label: Bebtelovimab EUA
clinical_nodes.content: FDA grants EUA for bebtelovimab despite 'basically no clinical data.'

clinical_nodes.label: Sotrovimab EUA Restricted
clinical_nodes.content: Sotrovimab EUA revised to exclude areas with high BA.2 prevalence, including New Jersey. Later fully revoked.

clinical_nodes.label: Bebtelovimab EUA Revoked — The Virus Wins
clinical_nodes.content: Bebtelovimab, the last available monoclonal antibody, has its EUA revoked. 'The virus has won the arms race.'

personal_nodes.label: MAB Paper Submitted
personal_nodes.content: MAB paper submitted to Journal of Medical Virology (JMV) after rejection from many journals.

personal_nodes.label: MAB Paper Published
personal_nodes.content: MAB paper officially published in Journal of Medical Virology.

chapters.title: Vaccination Peregrination
chapters.subtitle: From 50% Threshold to 300 Shots
chapters.vibe_description: A rare chapter of optimism in a dark year. The arrival of vaccines — 90% efficacy news that blew everyone away — and the shared joy of vaccination clinics. Pharmacists give hope a shot.

clinical_nodes.label: FDA Vaccine Efficacy Threshold
clinical_nodes.content: FDA publishes guidance for industry: a Covid-19 vaccine must demonstrate at least 50% efficacy to receive authorization.

clinical_nodes.label: Director of Pharmacy Cautions Against Vaccine
clinical_nodes.content: Prominent NJ/NY pharmacy administrator emails a large list serv urging extreme caution: recommends waiting for full FDA approval PLUS 6 months of post-marketing data before vaccinating. Advises pharmacists to carry liability insurance.

clinical_nodes.label: FDA: Two Months Safety Data Required
clinical_nodes.content: FDA announces it requires two months of safety data before issuing any vaccine EUA, effectively eliminating the possibility of pre-election approval.

clinical_nodes.label: RWJBH Vaccine Task Force
clinical_nodes.content: First email from Indu (RWJBH CPO) about internal vaccine task force formation.

clinical_nodes.label: Pfizer 90% Efficacy Announced
clinical_nodes.content: Tim (PGY1 resident) tells author the news: Pfizer vaccine is 90% effective. 'I remember being blown away. Thrilled.' All experts were similarly stunned by the magnitude of efficacy.

clinical_nodes.label: Steve Watches FDA VRPAC Meeting
clinical_nodes.content: Author watches most of the FDA Vaccines and Related Biological Products Advisory Committee meeting on the Pfizer vaccine. Will watch many more VRPAC and ACIP meetings over the next year.

clinical_nodes.label: Pfizer EUA Granted
clinical_nodes.content: FDA grants EUA for the Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine.

clinical_nodes.label: Steve Gets Pharmacist Immunizer License
clinical_nodes.content: Author obtains his pharmacist immunizer license.

clinical_nodes.label: Moderna EUA Granted
clinical_nodes.content: FDA grants EUA for the Moderna Covid-19 vaccine.

clinical_nodes.label: First Vaccines at CBMC
clinical_nodes.content: First day of vaccine administration at CBMC. Author vaccinated at 5pm — an hour after clinic scheduled to close — as vaccine team looks for volunteers to use up remaining doses. He was not in the first priority group.

clinical_nodes.label: Steve Starts Vaccinating
clinical_nodes.content: First day author administers vaccinations. Initially staff only, then public. Provides over 300 vaccinations over the next four months at CBMC, Essex County (former Sears at Livingston Mall), and an elementary school gym in West Orange.

personal_nodes.label: NEJM Podcast Revelation
personal_nodes.content: Author starts listening to NEJM Interviews podcast — weekly Covid-19 literature updates. First realization that vaccine mandates might happen, that this would be the biggest vaccination campaign in history, and that he needed to get licensed to vaccinate.

personal_nodes.label: Missed the Tweet
personal_nodes.content: Author was upset he missed the Pfizer 90% efficacy tweet — Tim (resident) was the one who told him. He had been checking Twitter 2-4x per day all year.

personal_nodes.label: Joy at the Vaccine Clinic
personal_nodes.content: 'I remember the shared sense of positivity, excitement and joy among the vaccinators and public. Everyone was happier than they had been in nearly a year.'

personal_nodes.label: Notable Vaccinees
personal_nodes.content: Author vaccinates the Chair of Medicine and several physicians he works with. Also vaccinates Michael McLeod of the NJ Devils and some minor league players. Supervises technicians vaccinating Alexander Holtz (NJ Devils 1st round pick).

personal_nodes.label: Indu Calls Before TV Appearance
personal_nodes.content: Indu (RWJBH CPO) calls author 20 minutes before a television appearance asking how to explain how the vaccines work.

chapters.title: Fox and Friends
chapters.subtitle: The HCQ Conflict Comes to a Head
chapters.vibe_description: A concentrated drama centered on one physician's continued advocacy for hydroxychloroquine after the evidence had turned against it — culminating in a Fox News appearance where the author is named by Dr. Smith, and a COO privately drops f-bombs in his defense.

clinical_nodes.label: P&T Memo: HCQ Prohibited
clinical_nodes.content: Author works with Dr. Rokosz (CMO), Pharmacy Director Heather, and Ali (AD) on a P&T memo to stop HCQ use for Covid-19. ID division votes on prohibition — passes by a narrow margin. Dr. Weiner (ID co-chair) completely unaware of the process; does not check email.

clinical_nodes.label: Rokosz vs. Smith Over HCQ Ban
clinical_nodes.content: Dr. Rokosz (CMO) and Dr. Smith (ID) clash directly over the HCQ ban.

clinical_nodes.label: Dr. Smith on Fox News — Names Steve Smoke
clinical_nodes.content: Dr. Smith returns to Fox News claiming his unpublished, retrospective study proves hydroxychloroquine works. He names the author by name on national television: 'I turned to the pharmacist, Steve Smoke at St. Barnabas and I said, I got people that are literally more than four times difference in weight, one or both groups is getting the wrong dose.' The study is vastly inferior to available evidence and — to the author's knowledge — was never published.

clinical_nodes.label: Vindication: UTI Pathway Praised
clinical_nodes.content: Dr. Yodice (Chair of Medicine) sends an email praising Steve's work on an unrelated UTI antimicrobial stewardship pathway to the CEO, CFO, and CMO. Dr. Rokosz (CMO) responds in agreement.

clinical_nodes.label: COO Private Support
clinical_nodes.content: The COO comes down to Steve's office for a private conversation. Says the institution supports him, that he shouldn't have to deal with what happened, and 'drops some f-bombs about Dr. Smith.'

clinical_nodes.label: RECOVERY Trial: HCQ No Benefit
clinical_nodes.content: RECOVERY trial determines no benefit from hydroxychloroquine in hospitalized Covid-19 patients. Author distributes details and clinical trial contact info to ID physicians.

clinical_nodes.label: HCQ EUA Revoked
clinical_nodes.content: FDA officially revokes the emergency use authorization for hydroxychloroquine.

clinical_nodes.label: RECOVERY Trial: Dexamethasone Reduces Mortality
clinical_nodes.content: RECOVERY trial reports dexamethasone reduces mortality — a landmark finding. Questions arise about whether a trial report (not peer-reviewed) is sufficient to change practice. RWJBH waits for NIH guideline update but Indu is pressured by Dr. Nahass to act sooner.

clinical_nodes.label: Ivermectin Returns — Bessler Confrontation
clinical_nodes.content: Dr. Bessler (ID) and Dr. Mouravskaia (ID) order ivermectin. Author pushes back. Dr. Bessler is very rude: 'How dare you?… I've been practicing medicine for X years…' Compares situation to bamlanivimab. Bamlanivimab later proven effective; ivermectin is not.

personal_nodes.label: Named on Fox News
personal_nodes.content: Author is named by Dr. Smith on Fox News in context of a disagreement over HCQ dosing methodology. The clip and transcript are preserved as external links.

personal_nodes.label: COO Drops F-Bombs
personal_nodes.content: The hospital COO visits Steve's office privately to offer personal support and express frustration with Dr. Smith.

personal_nodes.label: HCQ Paper Accepted
personal_nodes.content: The hydroxychloroquine paper is accepted for publication (submitted to JCPT February 25, 2021, after rejection from several journals).

personal_nodes.label: Opinion Article Published
personal_nodes.content: Opinion article published in Pharmacy Practice News. Key themes: difficulty determining what therapies work; misinformation from the messy scientific process being in the spotlight; importance of humility and saying 'I don't know'; the essential role of patients volunteering for RCTs.
